00019 #ifndef _ASTERISK_MANAGER_H
00020 #define _ASTERISK_MANAGER_H
00021 
00022 #include <stdarg.h>
00023 #include <sys/types.h>
00024 #include <sys/socket.h>
00025 #include <netinet/in.h>
00026 #include <arpa/inet.h>
00027 
00028 #include "asterisk/lock.h"
00029 
00030 /*!
00031  \file
00032  \brief The AMI - Asterisk Manager Interface - is a TCP protocol created to
00033  manage Asterisk with third-party software.
00034 
00035  Manager protocol packages are text fields of the form a: b.  There is
00036  always exactly one space after the colon.
00037 
00038  The first header type is the "Event" header.  Other headers vary from
00039  event to event.  Headers end with standard \r\n termination.
00040  The last line of the manager response or event is an empty line.
00041  (\r\n)
00042 
00043  ** Please try to re-use existing headers to simplify manager message parsing in clients.
00044     Don't re-use an existing header with a new meaning, please.
00045     You can find a reference of standard headers in doc/manager.txt
00046  */
00047 
00048 #define AMI_VERSION        "1.0"
00049 #define DEFAULT_MANAGER_PORT 5038   /* Default port for Asterisk management via TCP */
00050 
00051 #define EVENT_FLAG_SYSTEM     (1 << 0) /* System events such as module load/unload */
00052 #define EVENT_FLAG_CALL       (1 << 1) /* Call event, such as state change, etc */
00053 #define EVENT_FLAG_LOG        (1 << 2) /* Log events */
00054 #define EVENT_FLAG_VERBOSE    (1 << 3) /* Verbose messages */
00055 #define EVENT_FLAG_COMMAND    (1 << 4) /* Ability to read/set commands */
00056 #define EVENT_FLAG_AGENT      (1 << 5) /* Ability to read/set agent info */
00057 #define EVENT_FLAG_USER                 (1 << 6) /* Ability to read/set user info */
00058 #define EVENT_FLAG_CONFIG     (1 << 7) /* Ability to modify configurations */
00059 #define EVENT_FLAG_DTMF       (1 << 8) /* Ability to read DTMF events */
00060 
00061 /* Export manager structures */
00062 #define AST_MAX_MANHEADERS 128
00063 
00064 /* Manager Helper Function */
00065 typedef int (*manager_hook_t)(int, const char *, char *); 
00066 
00067 
00068 struct manager_custom_hook {
00069    /*! Identifier */
00070    char *file;
00071    /*! helper function */
00072    manager_hook_t helper;
00073    /*! Linked list information */
00074    AST_RWLIST_ENTRY(manager_custom_hook) list;
00075 };
00076 
00077 /*! \brief Check if AMI is enabled */
00078 int check_manager_enabled(void);
00079 
00080 /*! \brief Check if AMI/HTTP is enabled */
00081 int check_webmanager_enabled(void);
00082 
00083 /*! Add a custom hook to be called when an event is fired */
00084 /*! \param hook struct manager_custom_hook object to add
00085 */
00086 void ast_manager_register_hook(struct manager_custom_hook *hook);
00087 
00088 /*! Delete a custom hook to be called when an event is fired */
00089 /*! \param hook struct manager_custom_hook object to delete
00090 */
00091 void ast_manager_unregister_hook(struct manager_custom_hook *hook);
00092 
00093 struct mansession;
00094 
00095 struct message {
00096    unsigned int hdrcount;
00097    const char *headers[AST_MAX_MANHEADERS];
00098 };
00099 
00100 struct manager_action {
00101    /*! Name of the action */
00102    const char *action;
00103    /*! Short description of the action */
00104    const char *synopsis;
00105    /*! Detailed description of the action */
00106    const char *description;
00107    /*! Permission required for action.  EVENT_FLAG_* */
00108    int authority;
00109    /*! Function to be called */
00110    int (*func)(struct mansession *s, const struct message *m);
00111    /*! For easy linking */
00112    struct manager_action *next;
00113 };
00114 
00115 /* External routines may register/unregister manager callbacks this way */
00116 #define ast_manager_register(a, b, c, d) ast_manager_register2(a, b, c, d, NULL)
00117 
00118 /* Use ast_manager_register2 to register with help text for new manager commands */
00119 
00120 /*! Register a manager command with the manager interface */
00121 /*!   \param action Name of the requested Action:
00122    \param authority Required authority for this command
00123    \param func Function to call for this command
00124    \param synopsis Help text (one line, up to 30 chars) for CLI manager show commands
00125    \param description Help text, several lines
00126 */
00127 int ast_manager_register2(
00128    const char *action,
00129    int authority,
00130    int (*func)(struct mansession *s, const struct message *m),
00131    const char *synopsis,
00132    const char *description);
00133 
00134 /*! Unregister a registred manager command */
00135 /*!   \param action Name of registred Action:
00136 */
00137 int ast_manager_unregister( char *action );
00138 
00139 /*! 
00140  * \brief Verify a session's read permissions against a permission mask.  
00141  * \param ident session identity
00142  * \param perm permission mask to verify
00143  * \returns 1 if the session has the permission mask capabilities, otherwise 0
00144  */
00145 int astman_verify_session_readpermissions(unsigned long ident, int perm);
00146 
00147 /*!
00148  * \brief Verify a session's write permissions against a permission mask.  
00149  * \param ident session identity
00150  * \param perm permission mask to verify
00151  * \returns 1 if the session has the permission mask capabilities, otherwise 0
00152  */
00153 int astman_verify_session_writepermissions(unsigned long ident, int perm);

00155 /*! External routines may send asterisk manager events this way */
00156 /*!   \param category   Event category, matches manager authorization
00157    \param event   Event name
00158    \param contents   Contents of event
00159 */
00160 
00161 /* XXX the parser in gcc 2.95 gets confused if you don't put a space
00162  * between the last arg before VA_ARGS and the comma */
00163 #define manager_event(category, event, contents , ...)   \
00164         __manager_event(category, event, __FILE__, __LINE__, __PRETTY_FUNCTION__, contents , ## __VA_ARGS__)
00165 
00166 int __attribute__ ((format(printf, 6, 7))) __manager_event(int category, const char *event,
00167                         const char *file, int line, const char *func,
00168                         const char *contents, ...);

00171 const char *astman_get_header(const struct message *m, char *var);

00173 /*! Get a linked list of the Variable: headers */
00174 struct ast_variable *astman_get_variables(const struct message *m);

00177 void astman_send_error(struct mansession *s, const struct message *m, char *error);
00178 void astman_send_response(struct mansession *s, const struct message *m, char *resp, char *msg);
00179 void astman_send_ack(struct mansession *s, const struct message *m, char *msg);
00180 void astman_send_listack(struct mansession *s, const struct message *m, char *msg, char *listflag);

00185 int init_manager(void);

00194 char *authority_to_str(int authority, char *res, int reslen);
